newsitem.title: ARMENIA: Armenia to present 1997 draft budget to parliament.
newsitem.headline: Armenia to present 1997 draft budget to parliament.

text.p: Armenia's government will present its 1997 draft budget on Tuesday to parliament, which may approve it on February 17 or 18, government officials said.
The government is planning a budget deficit of 4.5 percent of gross domestic product, well below last year's target of 7-8 percent.
Annual inflation is planned at 9.5-10.5 percent after approximately 10 percent last year.
Revenues are set at 113.10 billion drams, 30 percent above last year's targets, while expenditure is due to total 147.50 billion drams, a 22 percent increase on 1996 levels.

The officials did not give any forecasts of economic growth in 1997. Armenia was the first Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS) member to record economic growth over the past few years. GDP rose 4.5 percent in January-September 1996.
Officials said the deficit would be mostly covered by foreign loans, including a $60 million loan from the World Bank and $15 million from the U.S. government.
